title: Public transport for the A League Round 3 - Melbourne Victory v Melbourne City: Saturday 22 October 2022
articleContent:
Public transport for the A League Round 3 - Melbourne Victory v Melbourne City: Saturday 22 October 2022

Isuzu UTE A League Men’s is back at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the big Melbourne derby taking place with Victory take on City. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Saturday 22 October.

The event will begin at 7.45pm.

Before you travel

We strongly encourage you to register your myki so that we can contact you if you have been exposed to coronavirus (COVID-19) on a public transport service. Register your myki now - it's quick and easy.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Ringwood – leaving 10:24pm from Platform 9
  • Belgrave – leaving at 10:12pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley - leaving at 10:20pm from Platform 10
  • Frankston – leaving at 9:50pm & 10:19pm from Platform 4
  • Pakenham – leaving at 9:55pm from Platform 6
  • Dandenong – leaving at 10:08pm from Platform 6
  • Sandringham - leaving at 9:55pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70a

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle service with 8 additional trams Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the A League Round 3 - Melbourne Victory v Melbourne City: Saturday 22 October 2022
